tasks.task: Understand the principles and implementation of conservation agriculture.
subtasks: Listen to the explanation of conservation agriculture's three principles (minimum soil disturbance, maximum soil cover, crop rotation).
Note the contrast between conservation agriculture and conventional methods.
Recognize the benefits of conservation agriculture (reduced costs, improved water retention, better yields).
Identify the Kenya Serial Enhancement Program (KSEP crawl) and its effective year (2014).
Note the partners involved in KSEP crawl (Kenya's government, European Union, International Fund for Agricultural Development).
Understand the value chain approach of KSEP crawl in supporting smallholder farmers.
Explain the role of conservation agriculture service providers in rolling out interventions.
Note the impact of these service providers (e.g., number of farmers benefiting, increased yields).

tasks.task: Review the case study of a successful farmer.
subtasks: Identify the farmer's experience with K-Safe conservation agriculture (354 acres, 600 acres).
Note the benefits reported by the farmer (trained farmers, storage, bountiful yields).

tasks.task: Identify the future outlook for conservation agriculture.
subtasks: Note the optimistic view presented towards conservation agriculture's future.
